intro: Trigonostemon villosus, commonly known as the hairy trigonostemon, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, typically greenish-yellow in color. Trigonostemon villosus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
